title: Amy Gourlay
subtitle: I am a Web Application Developer with 2+ years' experience currently looking for new opportunities within the field of Frontend Development.

publication.title: Peer Reviewed Publications (Juried)
publication.subtitle: Amy Gourlay, Michael Crabb. Graphic Novel Subtitles: Requirement Elicitation and System Implementation. In Proceedings of the 2021 ACM IMX Conference on Interactive Media Experiences (IMX ’21). Online.

mohc.description1: Responsible for building and maintaining high quality web applications, including several ecommerce sites.
mohc.description2: Experience working in large agile teams as well as on solo projects, taking a concept from discussion & design to a fully functional end-product. Participated in project planning by assigning accurate estimates for task difficulty and duration.
mohc.description3: Directly communicated with clients and conveyed technical concepts in a friendly, easy-to-understand manner.

uod.description1: Keep track of all expenses, monitor money coming into the account, pay invoices, keep excel spreadsheet up-to-date and accurate.
uod.description2: Communicate with the other members of the committee and contribute to other responsibilities and events within the club.

research.title: Final Year Research Project
research.description: I developed an alternative media consumption method that is based on combining video keyframes with subtitle text to create a comic-type experience. I found that the cognitive demands associated with watching subtitled material can often hinder the enjoyment of the content. Part of my project has been published at the ACM IMX’21 conference. I was also awarded the Sir James Black Award for this project for my outstanding contribution to research and scholarship in my field.

outreach.title: Community Outreach
outreach.description: I have promoted STEM opportunities within primary schools and have assisted in running code classes for children aged 7-10. In these classes, I taught basic coding principles and used the learning software, Scratch, as a method for students to participate in an interactive and engaging manner.

exchange.title: International Summer Exchange
exchange.description: I completed an 8-week summer exchange at East China University of Science and Technology in Shanghai. I conducted research involving medical technology and management of medical information. Supporting this I have taken Mandarin up to HSK2 and plan to continue this in the future.
